Articles.Content: Just played around with my Chaika again, and this little biplane actually gives me more kills than my Sturmovik. A biplane taking down one Yak-1 is impressive enough, but I was able to get seven planes of roughly tier 5 before my little biplane was rammed down by a teammate.

Biplanes are extremely agile, with the Chaika being one of the most agile. It was used to good effect in the Spanish civil war and for the Chinese against the Japanese.

But how did you keep up with the fighters, they would of been able to outrun you.

You'd think so, but the Chaika can reliably keep around 500km/h, it just needs a dive to get started. I was able to chase down two of the fighters and down them, one of them a Hayabusa, which logically should have nailed me easily. The other two fighters I was more or less stationary while fighting: they just turned around me a lot trying to get me in their sights, and I could shoot at their pilots more or less all the time. I was able to chase down a H6K bomber even after a steep climb, and took out his pilot when he turned to shake me off. The other two were twin-engine divebombers, and I could keep up with the first one rather easily, dodge the fire from their rear gunners, and then shoot out the pilot while he was turning. The other divebomber I took down by simply diving from straight above and shooting out his pilot directly. Poor sod probably didn't even know I was there.

I would of thought it would be slow as the extra drag from the bi-wings would of increased drag.

I was once 1-shot killed by a AA gun. In one of my first games in a fury biplane, a AA gun must of fired a single shot at me but I didn't notice as the next thing the aircraft panned out to show that your dead then it focused on the AA gun. There was no visible damage to the plane. It must of hit me in the cockpit with a single shot.

It's a bit irritating how pathetic the AA guns are, actually. A single one of those flak shells explodes near your plane, it's going to be shredded. Simple as that. As it is now, they barely cause an itch. But yeah, I've gotten pilotkilled by AA as well.
dodn't think that has happened to me yet but i usually attack them horizontally so they cant aim at me.

So, I was flying my new Bf109, that I finally managed to unlock. Getting chased by a Wildcat, decided, "I have to put this thing down somewhere". So, hoping he'd leave me alone, I put my plane down. No such luck. He comes around and strafes me, angled down and at a low altitude. Well, he gets me, but he must have overestimated his elevator authority.

He hits the ground, and, since I scored some hits on him, I score a kill. Yay.

But, my new favourite pastime is bomber intercepting. I like flying behind those Catalinas with my Bf110, just taking all their fire and murdering their wings with my cannons.

Just unlocked a Catalina and took it into a game. Absolutely a fighter magnent of the worst kind, and my crew gunners couldn't hit a barn if it jumped in front of them.

Dropped one bomb with it onto an AAA bunker, and instantly swarmed by fighters. Needless to say my brand new catalina was shot full of holes in seconds.

Okay, is it just me or is investing in extra crew as early as possible a really good idea.

Buying additional crews gives you additional planes in arcade mode, increasing your chances of getting higher scores and earning back more silver per mission.

Definitely for arcade where if your plane gets shot down you can switch to another one. I would just wish that they don't cost golden eagles after the 5th crew.

I fly with a joystick, so as I'm flying my plane the fighters assume that it's the AI in the gunner. So, they sit there and allow me to shoot them to pieces.

My only experience with go-carts was flipping over and scraping my arm against the ground with the remaining speed, so I'm not entirely sure a comparison with them is very favourable, but the high turn speed is common to all early fighters and biplanes, the only real advantage the Soviets have there is good guns. Their speed is almost entirely subpar when compared to the other planes. Not that that is really a disadvantage, with every plane being a turn fighter.

I just fought a Beaufort bomber with a Hurricane mk2. That Beaufort took 3/4 full clips of 12 .303 machine gun and yet it wasn't shot down till a short burst from another fighter took out the pilot in the cockpit. That Beaufort has a engine fire, 2 fuel leaks, damaged control surfaces and a unconscious rear gunner and yet could still fly and take out heavy tanks...
